snippet: Health officials are watching Lagos, the metropolis where all of Nigeria’s Ebola cases have been reported, with intense interest.
abstract: Health workers have brought Ebola outbreak to tentative standstill in Nigeria, offering at least a chance to eradicate disease there before it spins out of control, as it has in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

byline.contributor: Ben Ezeamalu contributed reporting from Lagos, Nigeria, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Health officials are watching Lagos, the metropolis where all of Nigeria’s Ebola cases have been reported, with intense interest.

headline.main: With Ebola Cases Still Few, Populous Nigeria Has Chance to Halt Its Outbreak
headline.print_headline: With Ebola Cases Still Few, Populous Nigeria Has Chance to Halt Its Outbreak

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
